title: Energy4All
text:
Energy4All facilitates the creation and development of community energy in the United Kingdom, based on the experience gained in the creation of the UK's first wind co-op, <a href="Baywind%20Energy%20Co-operative">Baywind Energy Co-operative</a>. It has gone on to raise over <a href="https%3A//energy4all.co.uk/about-us/our-history/">£40m</a> on behalf of the co-operatives and community benefit societies through community share offerings.
Energy4All is a <a href="https%3A//beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04545379">private limited company established in 2002</a> that has helped create <a href="https%3A//energy4all.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/E4A-Annual-Rep-Aug18-web.pdf">24</a> community energy projects, including <a href="Westmill%20Wind%20Farm%20Co-operative">Westmill Wind Farm Co-operative</a> and <a href="Boyndie">Boyndie</a> Wind Farm Co-operative, who, along with Baywind, own Energy4All.
One of the co-operatives it has created, Energy Prospects Co-operative, specialises in taking early stage co-operatives through the development and <a href="planning%20application">planning application</a> stages to the point where a community share offer, managed by Energy4All, can be launched to fund the project. 
Energy4All won an <a href="Ashden%20Award">Ashden Award</a> in 2012.
Energy4All was elected to Board of <a href="REScoop.eu">REScoop</a> the European Federation of renewable energy cooperatives in 2017 and is a participant in the MECISE project to develop a European cooperative energy investment fund.
